Params: {1: '1', 3: 'Vanessa stands at the podium, expressionless, presenting the report on "Kurono?Orphanage". Below her, several commandants invited to the briefing whisper among themselves.'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'During this operation, together with Construct? Bambinata and Construct? Vera of the Cerberus squad, we recovered early research logs on the Inver?Device—', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Female Commandant', 3: "So that's Vanessa... I hear she loves customizing coatings for her Constructs...", 4: '18'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Male Commandant', 3: 'Tsk, wasting resources on that in times like these.', 4: '18'}

{2: 'Vanessa', 3: '<color=#ffffffff><size=42>The "owner" of the orphanage is a semi-awakened mechanoid. Originally just a caretaker monitoring test data, it developed self-awareness under the influence of the Punishing Virus...</size></color>', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Vanessa raises her voice. The room goes quiet for a moment, but the murmurs soon return.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Female Commandant', 3: 'Yeah, and I heard one of the Constructs under her has problems too—something about her memory modules? She can only hold data for a short time.', 4: '18'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Male Commandant', 3: 'Oh, right. I heard something like that from logistics. What a waste, using resources on that instead of repairs...', 4: '18'}
{3: 'The male commandant, who had been gossiping, suddenly falls silent. An eerie hush descends upon the conference room, rendering even their hushed whispers deafening in the stillness.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'From the podium, Vanessa watches the two of them without a word. The others in the room follow her gaze.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'After a few awkward coughs and chuckles, the two commandants quickly compose themselves.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Vanessa', 3: "If you can't respect others, at least respect the occasion.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'She let the words hang in the air. Her gaze sweeps across the audience like a blade, pausing deliberately on someone in particular.'}
{3: 'Vanessa lets out a cold scoff, then turns her attention back to the report.'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'Among the samples we recovered, the most valuable are fragments of consciousness data that can no longer be replicated. They might help improve the Inver-Device...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Vanessa', 3: 'We\'re hoping to modify the Inver-Device enough to try "metabolizing" the Punishing Virus...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Lee murmurs the words on the screen, distracted as he follows the calibration instructions, adjusting each module in sequence.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Can this specialized Inver-Device really accomplish something like that?', 4: '1'}
{3: "Asimov's voice comes through the system. Data scrolls across Lee's screen, and a new set of instructions appears."}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Also, at full capacity, your frame could theoretically surpass time and dimensional constraints.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: '...I suppose only you could propose such a theory and get it approved for evaluation.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Lee's frame movements become larger, and on the monitors, every parameter begins to spike rapidly."}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "That's not my concern. I'm only responsible to what I've verified. Whether they believe it or not is up to them.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'More importantly, are you feeling any discomfort?', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'This frame relies heavily on the Heteromer Shard analysis. If anything feels wrong, stop immediately.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Alright. Moving to the next stage... I've unlocked the frame's full computing capacity. Give it a try.", 4: '2'}
{3: "As Asimov's voice fades, Lee senses a change in the frame. Many module restrictions lift, and some disabled functions reactivate."}
{3: "A distorted growl sharpens into clarity, catching Lee's attention as simulated monsters begin to form around him."}
{3: 'The live feed shows Lee, now in his Hyperreal frame, opening Hypermatrix abilities and calmly mowing down the simulated monsters.'}
{2: '...Is specialized frame switching always this dangerous?', 3: '84', 4: 'Looks dangerous.', 5: '84'}
{2: "...Something doesn't feel right.", 3: '87', 4: 'Did the procedure get more complex?', 5: '87'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "This isn't the dangerous part. Actually, the dangerous part's already past.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "The real concern isn't the complexity. Some steps in the process can risk damaging the M.I.N.D. Seems no one briefed you.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The Gray?Raven lounge is bright. Lee sits there, tool in hand, fine?tuning the delicate parts in his right arm.'}
{2: 'Why not let the maintenance team handle it...', 3: '99'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "And I don't want to make people do for me what I can just do for myself."}
{3: 'Lee always looks like a lone wolf, but people who do know him know that he is just used to putting the burden on his own shoulders.'}
{2: "How's everything coming along with the adaptation tests?", 3: '103'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'I believe I sent you a report every time there was a test.'}
{2: "But I'm curious about what didn't go into the reports.", 3: '106', 4: 'The data in the reports were pretty limited, though.', 5: '106'}
{3: '"Sudden M.I.N.D. overload," "hallucinations during adaptation"—none of that sounds like "everything\'s fine."'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Now, about the "sudden M.I.N.D. overload"... I don\'t know what\'s causing it, but it hasn\'t affected the frame or its battle performance.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Everything about the new frame is within normal standards...'}
{3: 'The hushed conversation fades into the shroud of night.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: "Because of confidentiality protocols and the Construct M.I.N.D. stability agreement, I can't share the full process with you.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'If you\'re concerned, you should ask him directly what "the dangerous part" means.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'All I can say is—thanks to your "visions," we were able to avoid a lot of setbacks when reconstructing certain technologies.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Asimov pulls up the status overview for Lee's frame. Data streams down the screen—mostly yellow and green, almost no red alerts."}
{1: '1', 3: 'He minimizes the window. The screen now shows Lee turning with precision and gunning down the last simulated Corrupted. After a pause, Asimov takes out a document.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The evaluation still has a few steps left, but everything looks good. Go ahead and sign off. Approve the switch to the Hyperreal frame.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "After that, we'll continue collecting calibration data through live missions.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'As soon as those words are spoken, a crisp electronic female voice sounds.'}
{2: 'Electronic Voice', 3: 'Test complete. Combat simulation shutting down.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The chamber door opens slowly. Lee wakes inside the experimental pod.'}
{2: 'How do you feel, Lee?', 3: '147', 4: "Don't usually see you from this angle...", 5: '142'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "That's because most of the time, I'm the one looking at you—lying in a medic pod, or at Star of Life.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Lee opens his eyes, looking mildly exasperated.'}
{3: 'Lee pauses, then takes your hand and uses it to pull himself up.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'No abnormalities detected. The frame is adapting well.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "We haven't even come close to its performance ceiling. We should try other combat scenarios in upcoming field missions to see how it holds up.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: "Alright, let's switch you back to the Entropy frame for now. I'll make one last adjustment to the Hyperreal.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "It'll take about an hour. Come back after that for the switch.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'After Asimov turns back to his lab bench, you and Lee exchange a glance and leave the lab.'}
{3: 'The afternoon sun shines brightly over Babylonia.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Let's get lunch first, Commandant. By the time we finish, it'll be about time...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov told me something dangerous happened during the adaptation process.', 3: '167'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'It was just a minor M.I.N.D. overload. I can handle it...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov wouldn\'t call it "dangerous" if it were just a minor issue.', 3: '172', 4: 'I don\'t think it\'s "minor."', 5: '172'}
{2: "It's just... every time one of you switches to a specialized frame, something happens—something I can't control.", 3: '175'}
{1: '1', 3: 'It was the same with Plume. And with Empyrea.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Sensing a change in your tone, Lee pauses before continuing quietly.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Don't worry. This time, nothing's going to happen.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'I know you can handle a lot on your own, Lee.', 3: '188'}
{2: 'But... please try to trust me more.', 3: '189', 4: 'But... please try to trust Gray Raven more.', 5: '191'}
{2: "I don't know what you're carrying inside. I can't see it.", 3: '190'}
{2: "But I hope you'll let me share some of your burden.", 3: '191'}
{3: 'The sun is too bright for you to clearly see his expression.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Let's eat first. Once the frame switch is done, we'll have more time to talk about the M.I.N.D. overload.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'You and Lee return to the Science Council lab. He gives you a reassuring nod before lying back in the experimental pod.'}
{3: 'Just like before, Lee skillfully takes the connection cable and connects it to the port at the back of his neck. At that moment—'}
{3: "The sensation returns—another wave of deja vu. It's quick and light this time, so much so that the word slips out before you even realize it."}
{2: "...Nothing. It's just that this is the first time I've seen one of you switch to a specialized frame in person.", 3: '214'}
{3: "Clearly, this isn't the right moment to continue that conversation."}
{3: 'Lee gives you a gentle nod before settling into the pod.'}
{3: 'For now, the only sound in the lab is the faint hum of machines.'}
{1: '>>>> Commencing frame switch authorization, please enter the activation parameter.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '1', 9: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Asimov inputs the startup parameters one by one.'}
{1: '>>>> Please refrain from interrupting the connection during consciousness transfer.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}
{1: '>>>> Please refrain from interrupting the connection during consciousness transfer.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '1'}
{1: '>>>> Please refrain from interrupting the connection during consciousness transfer.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '1', 9: '1'}
{3: 'You glance at Asimov in confusion after hearing the system repeat the transfer notice three times in a row.'}
{3: "He seems unfazed, casually scanning a few lines of data like it's routine."}
{1: '1', 3: 'Hyperreal lies still in the pod. His eyes remain closed.'}
{1: '>>>> Please refrain from interrupting the connection during consciousness transfer.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '1', 9: '1'}
{3: 'Flashes of light flicker across his vision as crimson fog engulfs everything.'}
{1: '>>>> Please refrain from interrupting the connection during consciousness transfer.', 2: 'ffffffff', 4: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 6: '1', 7: '1', 9: '1'}
{3: "But there was no sign of a failed transfer. No alerts. And Asimov didn't intervene..."}
{3: 'Time seems to freeze. It stops being just a concept, and becomes a real, twisting four-dimensional axis, spiraling endlessly in the fog.'}
{3: 'What is this place? Where is he right now?'}
{3: 'His M.I.N.D. stretches outward. Suspended by spider-silk threads, a twisted spiral tower hangs in the air. Its blinding gateway begins to open.'}
{3: 'A beam of light breaks through the mist, pouring in from beyond the sky.'}
{3: 'Tiny specks of golden light dispel the crimson fog.'}
{3: 'The chamber door opens as you rush toward him.'}
{3: 'He grabs your hand and slowly rises from the pod.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Asimov, how long did the consciousness transfer take?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Same as before. About three seconds longer than expected, but no errors, no abnormalities.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'So, what did you see this time?', 4: '2'}
{3: "The crimson fog vanishes from his M.I.N.D. just as suddenly as it appeared. There's barely a trace left."}
{3: 'Asimov scrolls through the records in silence, deep in thought.'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Most likely, there was an unexpected spike during the deep-layer transfer stage of your M.I.N.D.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Lucia and Liv's specialized frames adapted smoothly. This only happens with yours... so it has to be something with your deep M.I.N.D.—", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Lee cuts him off before he can finish the analysis.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Right. It's possible there's some corrupted data in my deep M.I.N.D., which caused the delay during the transfer.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "There are many things that could impact the frame. This one just isn't high on the list.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: "Today's delay isn't new. Earlier tests also took about three seconds longer than average during consciousness transfer. Everything else looks fine.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'Lee sits up in the pod, now in his Hyperreal frame.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Once the frame switch is done, I'll sort the data and file regular reports with the Science Council.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'When Lee entered the pod, you saw that "tower"...'}
{3: 'Could it be the same tower Vonnegut mentioned at the aquarium?'}
{2: 'Vonnegut', 3: 'Ascending the Tower with a mortal body?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'If this tower really is the same one Vonnegut mentioned...'}
{3: 'Questions keep piling up. By the time you snap back to reality, Lee and you have left the Science Council.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "Commandant? You've seemed distracted since the frame switch...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Did you see something? Like... the "visions" you had before?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: "Something flickers in Lee's M.I.N.D. at that word, but he can't catch it."}
{2: 'Since the aquarium incident, the "deja vu" moments have become few and far between.', 3: '390'}
{3: 'He nods and is about to say more when his terminal beeps.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Looks like I've got to go. A frame?performance test just came in.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "It's a Dead Zone operation to clear out Hetero-Creatures. The mission ID will be released once I land on the surface.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Yes. Some parameters need to be tested through solo action.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "Don't worry. The Hyperreal frame is built for this. I'll also make sure I'm fully prepared.", 4: '1'}
{3: "You hold back your concern, deciding to respect Lee's judgment, then exchange a light fist bump with Lee."}
{2: 'Good luck out there. See you when you get back.', 3: '404'}
{3: 'Lee stands with his back to the sunlight, looking at you.'}
